nz.co.jedsimson.lgp.core.evolution.training

Class DistributedTrainer<TProgram,TOutput extends Output<TProgram>>

  • Trainer
    • nz.co.jedsimson.lgp.core.evolution.training.DistributedTrainer<TProgram,TOutput>

  • public class DistributedTrainer<TProgram,TOutput extends Output<TProgram>>
extends Trainer

    Trains the model for a given number of runs, in a parallel manner.

    The model will be copied runs time and each copy will be trained in its own thread. The results of each model evaluation will be gathered once all the threads complete.

    This runner has significant overhead compared to the class SequentialTrainer, due to the extra memory needed for evaluating multiple models at once, as well as the overhead of the threads used.

    It should be noted that this trainer will create runs copies of the environment -- one for each model. This allows each model to have its own environment which can be isolated within the thread it is executed. This is mainly done to facilitate deterministic multi-threaded training, where it is necessary to make 100% sure that any state shared between threads does not affect the outcome of the training.

    See Also:
    class SequentialTrainer

        Trains the model for a given number of runs, in a parallel manner.

        The model will be copied runs time and each copy will be trained in its own thread. The results of each model evaluation will be gathered once all the threads complete.

        This runner has significant overhead compared to the class SequentialTrainer, due to the extra memory needed for evaluating multiple models at once, as well as the overhead of the threads used.

        It should be noted that this trainer will create runs copies of the environment -- one for each model. This allows each model to have its own environment which can be isolated within the thread it is executed. This is mainly done to facilitate deterministic multi-threaded training, where it is necessary to make 100% sure that any state shared between threads does not affect the outcome of the training.

        Parameters:
        runs - The number of times to train the given model.
        See Also:
